'Cause, if that's how you talk, then I'm going to tell you flat-out; _find a better way to talk._

> ...i mean freedom of speech?

As others have said, freedom of speech does not apply here. Riot isn't a government body, so your right to free speech isn't being infringed upon. You're still fully allowed to speak freely, but the 14-day ban is Riot expressing their freedom to apply repercussions for your use of hate speech and encouraging self-harm in their private space.

Here's a snippet from the [Terms of Use, Code of Conduct](https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse#code-conduct) - AKA, the rules that you agreed to follow, and which Riot can enforce at their discretion;

> The following are examples of behavior that warrant disciplinary measures:
>
> v. Transmitting or communicating any content which, in the sole and exclusive discretion of Riot Games, is deemed offensive, including language that is _unlawful_, _harmful_, threatening, _abusive_, harassing, defamatory, vulgar, obscene, sexually explicit, or _racially, ethically, or otherwise objectionable_;

I italicized the parts that I think apply most here.

Hate speech, of course, is harmful, abusive, and objectionable, and encouraging self-harm I'm 90% sure is unlawful pretty much everywhere, and harmful and abusive in no short capacity.

You're certainly free to say whatever you want, but if what you say breaks the rules, Riot is absolutely free to punish you as they see fit. Bear that in mind next time you try to bandy about freedom of speech.

> and what they dont show is that the enemy draven was talking the same way towards me, as he was a friend of mine

Other people's misbehavior does not absolve you of your own, and it doesn't matter if they were a friend or not. You broke the rules, someone reported you, you got punished. Them's the 8r8ks.
no, i wont greet the bus driver with a happy kys, ofcourse not. I will however joke with my friends, and the person i was talking to in that game happend to be a friend.
well the other 3 weren't. if you want to joke with your friends, use discord or something

And how many people on your team in that match _weren't_ your friend?

You don't get a free pass to break the rules just because you have one friend in the mix.

Not freedom of speech. Freedom of speech means the **government** can't persecute you for your speech.

Riot is a private company, they own the game and the servers. You have no freedom of speech. You drop hate speech, you get banned. Those are the rules.

Go into a bar and drop that racial or homophobic slur that you used and see how fast you get your ass bounced out of that **private** establishment.

*with limitations.  Even the government CAN persecute you for your speech under certain conditions (well known example includes yelling "FIRE!" in a crowded theater as a prank).

There are cases where the government prosecuted people for encouraging self-harm in real life.  Cyber bully is a punishable offense in certain States in the US.  Death threats are certainly going to get you arrested in real life. 
 Freedom of speech is not as unlimited as people seem to think, even when dealing with the government.
